title: (x) Acorn Antiques - The Musical! / left-pointing top serifs, right-pointing bottom serifs - Romic aka Schadow Antiqua {Florian}
content:
Help to identify this font is appreciated - thank you.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131019144944im_/http:/typophile.com/files/acorn_4790.jpg)
author: Banners

comments.content:
Hi,  
that’s [Schadow Antiqua](http://web.archive.org/web/20131019144944/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/urw/schadow-antiqua/?testdrive=dock%3Dfalse%26size%3D87%26w%3D720%26src%3Dcustom%26text%3DACORN%2520ANTIQUES%26fg%3D000000%26bg%3Dffffff%26goodies%3Dfit%252Cot.liga%26seed%3D27).  
Haven’t seen this one in a while.  
F
Cool, thanks a lot :-) It may also be [Romic Bold](http://web.archive.org/web/20131019144944/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/adobe/romic/bold/) apparently.

You’re right. I just discovered [this older thread](http://web.archive.org/web/20131019144944/http:/www.typophile.com/node/37415): URW++ probably have misnamed their fonts. This ‘Schadow Antiqua’ is actually [Colin Brignall](http://web.archive.org/web/20131019144944/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Colin%20Brignall)’s Romic.
